alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:20AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG WIND GUSTS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BIG HORN... SOUTHWESTERN POWDER RIVER...SOUTHERN ROSEBUD AND SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM MDT... At 218 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong winds from an advancing cold front. The leading edge of the strong winds was along a line extending from 9 miles south of Lame Deer to 19 miles southeast of Busby to 18 miles north of Sheridan to near Ranchester to Dayton. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton, Big Horn, Clearmont, Birney, Leiter, Tongue River Reservoir, Banner, Moorhead, Birney Village, Arvada, Otter, Ucross, and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
